title: The HashiConf Europe Highlights You Don’t Want to Miss
content:
It won’t be long until HashiCorp’s flagship European community conference, HashiConf Europe once again takes place online. From June 8 to 11, you can enjoy more than 25 technical sessions on 3 tracks, 10 product workshops, a wide array of Lightning Talks, and plenty of opportunities to connect with HashiCorp engineers and product experts via chat and live Q&As.

Log in to the HashiConf Europe platform to save sessions to your calendar.

If you have not yet had a chance to log in and view the full schedule, here are some highlights you won’t want to miss:

»HashiCorp Updates

Opening Keynotes

Be sure to join live as HashiCorp Co-Founders Mitchell Hashimoto and Armon Dadgar share exciting product updates and news during each of the HashiConf Europe Opening Keynotes.

June 8, 1:00 p.m. CEST / June 9, 1:00 p.m. CEST

»Infrastructure Sessions

Infrastructure Keynote: Devarshi Shah and Sabeen Syed‌, HashiCorp

Consul Senior Product Manager Devarshi Shah and Senior Engineering Manager Sabeen Syed deliver an infrastructure keynote covering Terraform and Consul.

June 8, 2:30 p.m. CEST

MediaMarkt's Journey to Compliance with Terraform: Bjoern Jessen-Noak, MediaMarktSaturn Technology

MediaMarktSaturn uses Terraform Enterprise to drive compliant infrastructure consumption across 70 teams. This talk covers their journey to proactive policy as code.

June 8, 3 p.m. CEST

Terraform at Decathlon: From On-prem to 100% Cloud: Vincent Logeon, Decathlon

From a fully on-premises infrastructure and Terraform OSS, Decathlon decided to move to Terraform Enterprise to leverage security and team-related features, and to speed up its cloud journey. Decathlon’s Terraform Enterprise Product Owner Vincent Logeon discusses this in detail.

June 8, 3:30 p.m. CEST

»Security Sessions

Security Keynote: Vinod Muralidhar and Harold Giménez, HashiCorp

Sr Director, Product Management for the Security Product Line Vinod Muralidhar and HashiCorp’s VP Engineering Harold Giménez will cover Vault, Consul, and Boundary in the Security Keynote on Day 2.

June 9, 1:30 p.m. CEST

It's All About Trust: Secrets at the Retail Edge: Andrew McCormick, Starbucks

Deep dive into the architectural patterns that Starbucks used to build secret and identity management capabilities for more than 100,000 retail edge devices.

June 8, 3:30 p.m. CEST

Protecting Privacy for Refugees With Vault: Nagib Aouini, DuoKey SA and Gil Talon, International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)

Learn about the technical architecture and challenges DuoKey and IRIC faced when building RedSafe, a Vault platform providing safe and secure services for humanitarian crises.

June 9, 2:30 p.m. CEST

Seamless Dynamic Credentials for Developer Tooling: Lucy Davinhart, Sky Betting & Gaming

Lucy is joining the HashiConf speaker lineup for the third time, and we are always pleased to welcome them back. In this year’s talk, they will outline how Sky Betting & Gaming enables developers to seamlessly grab dynamic credentials from Vault without them specifying which credentials they need.

June 9, 3:00 p.m. CEST

Secure Access Management With Boundary: Pete Pacent, HashiCorp and Charles Zaffery, Roblox

Charles Zaffery, Site Reliability Engineer at Roblox, joins Pete Pacent, Product Management Lead for Boundary, to discuss how Boundary automates identity-based access for any networked resource.

June 9, 2:00 p.m. CEST

The Zero Trust Mindset: Rob Barnes, HashiCorp

Learn about how service mesh, identity-based access management, and secrets management can help implement zero trust without increasing development friction.

June 8, 1:30 p.m. CEST

»Application Sessions

Application Keynote: Yishan Lin and Blake Covarrubias, HashiCorp

HashiCorp Product Manager for Nomad and Waypoint Yishan Lin and Senior Product Manager for Consul Blake Covarrubias cover what is in store for Nomad and Waypoint in the Application Keynote.

June 8, 1:30 p.m CEST

Making Movie Magic With Nomad: Carlos Robles and Jonathan Cross, Conductor Technologies

Learn how Conductor uses Nomad to drive industry-leading compute scale that enables VFX studios to render massive amounts of content on the cloud.

June 8, 2:30 p.m. CEST

Sustainable Nomad: Gale Fagan, HashiCorp

Attend this session for practical recommendations for optimal use of Nomad to achieve greater practitioner sustainability and better quality of life for operators.

June 9, 2:30 p.m. CEST

»Other Sessions and Workshops

In Conversation With Vicki Cheung: Vicki Cheung, Stealth, and Nic Jackson and Anubhav Mishra, HashiCorp

Vicki Cheung was previously a Senior Staff Software Engineer at Lyft, the Head of Infrastructure and a founding engineer at Open AI, and a founding engineer at Duolingo. She is now a Co-Founder and CTO at Stealth. Join HashiCorp's Nic Jackson and Anubhav Mishra as they sit down with her for a fireside chat.

June 8, 4:00 p.m. CEST

Product Workshops:

Workshops are led by HashiCorp engineers and experts in real-time on Zoom and include the latest product features to give you the most up-to-date information. During the workshops, you will have plenty of opportunities to ask questions and receive individualized feedback. Workshops require a separate ticket, so explore the full list and book yours now.

June 10 - 11

The HashiConf Europe platform is already open, so log in today using your HashiCorp user account to view the full event calendar and to start saving sessions to your personal schedule. Once inside, you can also view pre-released product videos on demand, sign up to host a Lightning Talk, and more. Note that sessions will be recorded and available to view on demand immediately after airing, so if you cannot join a session live, you can log in to watch the video whenever it’s convenient for you.

We look forward to seeing you there.
author: Amanda Perino
